availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bullitt and Union County, Kentucky, attorney. Son of Benjamin Chapeze and Elizabeth Shepherd Chapeze. Bullitt County Attorney from 1858 to 1862. Attorney in Bullitt County in 1863. Resident of Union County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt County, Shepherdsville, p. 677.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Morganfield Precinct, p. 349B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Bullitt County, KY, 1863.
History of Union County, Kentucky: A Complete Account of the Settlement, Organization and Government of the County, Together with Facts and Figures Concerning the Society, Professions, Commerce, Industries, Agriculture, Coal, Railroads, Education, Religion, and Other Institutions and Resources of the County, and Biographical Sketches of Its Leading Citizens (Evansville, IN: Courier Co., 1886): pp. 182-185.
J.H. Battle, W.H. Perrin, and G.C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, vol. II (Louisville, KY: F.A. Battey Publishing Company, 1885), p. 1021.
"Francis Patrick Kendrick 'Ken' Chapeze (1830-1889)," Find A Grave, Memorial 106123462, accessed December 16, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106123462.
